channel.title: Algos and Puzzles on A Developer's Experience
channel.description: Recent content in Algos and Puzzles on A Developer's Experience

item.title: Problem Reduction
item.description:
Problem Reduction is what I call when a given problem can be expressed in terms of or solved using a solution to an alternate problem.

Take for instance, the word distance problem: Find the shortest distance between two words in a given set of words. Following is an unanimous solution, I suppose:

item.title: Selective Combinations
item.description:
Consider this scenario:

You have a list of strings with which you have generate ordered selective combinations of strings starting with the first string in the list. Let us say the list of strings is abc, def and ghi. I have to generate ordered combinations of the above list restricted to the ones starting with abc.

So that would be as follows:

abc def ghi

abc def

abc ghi

abc

item.title: Linked List Quiz – Part II !!!
item.description: In the previous post, we saw the academic (not general purpose) version of a linked list used to solve the puzzles, and solved the following puzzles on linked list.

item.title: Linked List Quiz – Part I !!!
item.description: A short while back, Sammy quizzed me on linked list based problems; singly linked list.

item.title: Unique Id Generation !!!
item.description: A short while I was engaged in a little project where I had to interact with a third party service provider who required a (30 length) unique id as part of the transaction.

item.title: Quiz: Beauty of Numbers - Solution !!!
item.description: One hint that should be helpful in building our solution is that we got to get retained after every wave of removal (until nobody else remains).

item.title: Quiz: Beauty of Numbers !!!
item.description: Sriram quizzed: Imagine there is a queue of people for getting a ticket for a movie or somehing.
